attributes.action: Revise LA’s treatment of statutory law for vulnerable children and SEN children
attributes.background: Recently Essex County Council told me that after two years of me taking my daughter to school in my motibilty car. That were reducing the fuel payments or she could now go in a cab. I told them they couldn’t just change a already arranged travel plan because it would have a detrimental effect on her

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.
	
You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can find out how to complain about a decision made by your local council here: 

http://www.essex.gov.uk/customer-services/Pages/Complaints,-compliments-and-comments.aspx

You can find out how to complain about a decision made by your local council to the Local Government and Health Care Ombudsman here: 

https://www.lgo.org.uk/

You can find out more about complaining to an ombudsman here: 

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/consumer/get-more-help/how-to-use-an-ombudsman-in-england/
